byline.original: By JONATHAN MARTIN and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Gov Scott Walker of Wisconsin has found his political star rising as Conservative Political Action Conference commences outside Washington, in stark contrast to decline of longtime rival Gov Chris Christie of New Jersey; Walker's bid for the 2016 Republican nomination has gained significant ground as his poll numbers have risen.
lead_paragraph: On the first day of the conference, the contrasting standings of Scott Walker and Chris Christie in the early stages of the 2016 campaign reveal how quickly perceptions of the race can change.

headline.main: Rivals Christie and Walker Find Fortunes Reversed as CPAC Opens
headline.print_headline: In Early Stages of ’16 Race, Rivals Christie and Walker Find Fortunes Reversed

snippet: On the first day of the conference, the contrasting standings of Scott Walker and Chris Christie in the early stages of the 2016 campaign reveal how quickly perceptions of the race can change.
